title: Polterguardian
data:

| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [HP](/Hit_points "Hit points")                                                                      | 42-87                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| [HD](/Hit_dice "Hit dice")                                                                          | 11                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| [XP](/XP "XP")                                                                                      | 546                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| [Speed](/Monster_speed "Monster speed")                                                             | 10                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |

| [Will](/Willpower "Willpower")                                                                      | 80                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Attack1                                                                                             | 20 ([hit](/Attack_type "Attack type"): [plain](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour"))                                                                                                                                                   |
| [Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")                                                             | [rC+](/Cold "Cold") [rPois+++](/Poison "Poison") [rDrown](/Asphyxiation "Asphyxiation") [rMiasma](/Miasma "Miasma") [rN+++](/Negative_energy "Negative energy") [rTorm](/Torment "Torment") [rSticky](/Sticky_Flame "Sticky Flame") |

| [Size](/Size "Size")                                                                                | [Medium](/Category:Medium_monsters "Category:Medium monsters")                                                                                                                                                                      |
| [Type](/Type "Type")                                                                                | polterguardian, polterguardian                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Flags                                                                                               | [Flying](/Flying "Flying") [Insubstantial](/Insubstantial "Insubstantial") [Cautious](/Cautious "Cautious") [Aura](/Aura "Aura") [Evil](/Evil "Evil") [Unbreathing](/Unbreathing "Unbreathing")                                     |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| - | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Many poltergeists are fiercely territorial over the domains they choose to haunt, but these have extended that protection even to the people who share their domain with them. Some say they must be the lingering souls of those who guarded the Vaults in life; others suggest the Ironbound Order simply recruited them in common cause. Whichever is true, their very presence shelters other creatures from missiles, causing sling and spell alike to veer off-course at the last moment. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Polterguardians** are support casters, which give passive [repel missiles](/Repel_missiles "Repel missiles") to all allies in their [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight"). They appear in [the Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults") as a part of [vault warden](/Vault_warden "Vault warden") and [ironbound preserver](/Ironbound_preserver "Ironbound preserver") bands, but sometimes they spawn with just 1-2 random monsters.

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                  |                                                      |
| :---------- | ------------------------------------------------ | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Force Lance](/Force_Lance "Force Lance") (3d14) | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- If you see a monster in [the Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults") with the [Repel Missiles](/Repel_Missiles "Repel Missiles") effect, that means there's a polterguardian nearby.
- Polteguardians aren't much of a threat to melee characters, but [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons") users should take them out early so they have an easier time hitting other monsters. Casters should do the same if their main spells check [EV](/EV "EV") (e.g. [Bombard](/Bombard "Bombard") or [Plasma Beam](/Plasma_Beam "Plasma Beam")).
- Many AoE spells (e.g. [Fireball](/Fireball "Fireball"), [Ozocubu's Refrigeration](/Ozocubu%27s_Refrigeration "Ozocubu's Refrigeration"), [Irradiate](/Irradiate "Irradiate")) ignore EV and are not affected by [Repel Missiles](/Repel_Missiles "Repel Missiles").

## History

- In [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), polterguardians were added to the game.
html:
Polterguardian

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.32: This article is up to date for the latest stable release of Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.
polterguardian v 
HP 42-87
HD 11
XP 546
Speed 10
AC 6
EV 18
Will 80
Attack1 20 (hit: plain)


Resistances rC+
rPois+++
rDrown
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
rSticky
Vulnerabilities Holy
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Open doors
Holiness Undead
Size Medium
Type polterguardian, polterguardian
Flags Flying
Insubstantial
Cautious
Aura
Evil
Unbreathing
Many poltergeists are fiercely territorial over the domains they choose to haunt, but these have extended that protection even to the people who share their domain with them. Some say they must be the lingering souls of those who guarded the Vaults in life; others suggest the Ironbound Order simply recruited them in common cause. Whichever is true, their very presence shelters other creatures from missiles, causing sling and spell alike to veer off-course at the last moment.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Polterguardians are support casters, which give passive repel missiles to all allies in their line of sight. They appear in the Vaults as a part of vault warden and ironbound preserver bands, but sometimes they spawn with just 1-2 random monsters.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Force Lance (3d14) Magical flag

Tips & Tricks

  • If you see a monster in the Vaults with the Repel Missiles effect, that means there's a polterguardian nearby.
  • Polteguardians aren't much of a threat to melee characters, but Ranged Weapons users should take them out early so they have an easier time hitting other monsters. Casters should do the same if their main spells check EV (e.g. Bombard or Plasma Beam).
  • Many AoE spells (e.g. Fireball, Ozocubu's Refrigeration, Irradiate) ignore EV and are not affected by Repel Missiles.

History

  • In 0.32, polterguardians were added to the game.

rawPage:
{{version032}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Polterguardians''' are support casters, which give passive [[repel missiles]] to all allies in their [[line of sight]]. They appear in [[the Vaults]] as a part of [[vault warden]] and [[ironbound preserver]] bands, but sometimes they spawn with just 1-2 random monsters.

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*If you see a monster in [[the Vaults]] with the [[Repel Missiles]] effect, that means there's a polterguardian nearby.
*Polteguardians aren't much of a threat to melee characters, but [[Ranged Weapons]] users should take them out early so they have an easier time hitting other monsters. Casters should do the same if their main spells check [[EV]] (e.g. [[Bombard]] or [[Plasma Beam]]).
*Many AoE spells (e.g. [[Fireball]], [[Ozocubu's Refrigeration]], [[Irradiate]]) ignore EV and are not affected by [[Repel Missiles]].

==History==
*In [[0.32]], polterguardians were added to the game.
